meanings.definition: To make someone feel extremely frightened or scared.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie was so petrifying that I couldn't sleep at night.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loud noise petrified the little child.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was petrifying, but also kind of fun.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the forest at night seemed to be petrifying the brave hiker.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure emerging from the shadows was truly petrifying.

meanings.definition: To turn something into stone or a stony substance.
meanings.sent1: The ancient spell was said to petrify anyone who dared to enter the forbidden cave.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the elements slowly petrified the fallen tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's magic accidentally petrified his own hat into solid rock.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's skillful hands could petrify a block of marble into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The curse was so powerful that it could petrify anything it touched into stone.
